alert.note: Alert for Mason; McCulloch; San Saba (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 9:49AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN MCCULLOCH...NORTHERN MASON AND SAN SABA COUNTIES THROUGH 1030 AM CDT... At 948 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Goldthwaite to near Chappel to near Hedwigs Hill. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... San Saba, Mason, Algerita, Cherokee, Art, Pontotoc, Fredonia, Chappel, Sloan, Hedwigs Hill, Colorado Bend State Park, Harkeyville, Spring Creek, and Koockville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for west central Texas.
